Indian Institute of Science

IISc Quantum Computing Research Fellowship

Contribute to IISc's Centre for Quantum Technology on error correction and superconducting qubit simulations.

CompanyIndian Institute of Science
RoleResearch Fellow
LocationCV Raman Rd, Bengaluru
Duration12 months
StipendINR 55,000 per month
Work Hours40 hours/week
Employment TypeContract
Experience0-2 years research experience

Eligibility & Skills

  • Postgraduate students in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science with quantum computing exposure.
  • Education: M.Tech/M.Sc/MS in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science
  • Branches allowed: Physics, Electrical, Computer Science
  • Skills: Quantum circuits, Python, Superconducting qubits, Numerical modeling
  • Year of study: Postgraduate final year
  • Age limit: Max 28 years

Fellowship mission

  • Advance open quantum system simulations with IISc's superconducting qubit labs.
  • Publish in top-tier journals with joint authorship from faculty mentors.
  • Prototype algorithms for fault-tolerant quantum computing.

Program structure

  1. Orientation and project scoping with the Centre for Quantum Technology.
  2. Lab rotations across hardware fabrication, control systems, and theoretical modeling.
  3. Final symposium showcasing research outcomes to industry partners and government labs.

Application package

  • Curriculum vitae highlighting research experience.
  • Statement of purpose describing your quantum computing interests.
  • Two letters of recommendation from academic supervisors.

Selected fellows receive on-campus accommodation assistance and seed grants to attend international quantum computing conferences.

Ready to apply?

Applications close on 28 February 2026.
